# sendgrid_subuser (Resource)

Allows to create and manage subuser for your SendGrid account

## Example Usage

```hcl
resource "sendgrid_subuser" "subuser" {
  email      = "yourname@example.com"
  username   = "name.test"
  ips = [
    "" # your domain ip. you can get this from sendgrid-->settings-->Ip Address.
  ]
  password   = "yourpassword"
  disabled   = false # if you want to disable this subuser then change this value to true.
}

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `email` (String) Email address of the subuser
- `ips` (List of String) Scopes of the subuser
- `password` (String) Is read only of the subuser

### Optional

- `disabled` (Boolean) Token of the Pending subuser
- `username` (String) Username of the subuser

### Read-Only

- `id` (Number) ID of the subuser

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

```shell
terraform import sendgrid_subuser.example "username" # Replace 1234567890 with your subuser ID
```
